docs.abstract: Ed on Eckhardt-Broyhill bill to control sale of toxic substances; says some 60-90% of cancer is authoritatively attributed to environmental factors; says that of 30,000 chems now on mkt, 1,500 have been shown to have carcinogenic effects on animals
docs.snippet: Ed on Eckhardt-Broyhill bill to control sale of toxic substances; says some 60-90% of cancer is authoritatively attributed to environmental factors; says that of 30,000 chems now on mkt, 1,500 have been shown to have carcinogenic effects on animals

headline.main: Cancer Agency Amassing Clues on Disparity of the Disease in Various Regions of the World

docs.abstract: Walter Sullivan article on cancer notes that, as environmental roots are identified, it is hoped that this will point to factors entirely or partly responsible for cancer in more gen sense; notes that variety of recent findings have pointed to environmental factors as being critical (S)

byline.original: By WALTER SULLIVAN Special to The New York Times

keywords.value: TOBACCO, TOBACCO PRODUCTS AND SMOKERS ARTICLES
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: LYONS, France, June 1 A medical detective story of great potential importance in the fight against cancer is slowly unfolding, but while a mass of clues have been assembled, the final chapter remains to be written.
docs.snippet: LYONS, France, June 1 A medical detective story of great potential importance in the fight against cancer is slowly unfolding, but while a mass of clues have been assembled, the final chapter remains to be written.
